author: Staff Reporter
text:
Over 14,000 application forms were received in special camps held at 1,559 polling stations in six Assembly constituencies across the district.

The camps were organised for enrolment of voters, deletion of names and corrections in electoral roll on February 6, Collector M. Ravikumar told the media here on Monday.

A total of 10,489 Form - 6 for enrolling as new voters, 566 Forms 7 for deletion of voters from electoral roll, 2,687 Form 8 for making modifications and 693 Form 8 (A) for change of address within a constituency were issued.

A new batch of 750 ballot units and 1,500 control units for electronic voting machines to be used in polling booths for the upcoming assembly elections were expected to reach Thoothukudi from Maharashtra soon.

In the first batch, the district received a total of 2,300 ballot units and 2,030 control units from Gujarat, the Collector said.

A batch of 750 ballot units and 1,500 control units for EVMs are expected
title: Over 14,000 forms received in special camps
